Description: Example configuration with PostDeploy stage disabled (default behavior)
UsageNotes: This configuration demonstrates the default behavior with PostDeploy disabled.
The pipeline will have only 3 stages: Source → Build → Deploy.
will be created, reducing infrastructure costs and complexity.
This is suitable for simple applications that don't require post-deployment
PostDeploy parameters are still present but ignored when PostDeployStageEnabled is false.

PipelineStages.name: Source
PipelineStages.description: Retrieves source code from CodeCommit repository

PipelineStages.name: Build
PipelineStages.description: Executes buildspec.yml to build and package application

PipelineStages.name: Deploy
PipelineStages.description: Creates and executes CloudFormation changeset to deploy infrastructure

ResourcesNotCreated: PostDeployServiceRole - IAM role for PostDeploy CodeBuild project
PostDeployProject - CodeBuild project for post-deployment tasks
PostDeployLogGroup - CloudWatch log group for PostDeploy logs
WhenToUse: Simple applications without complex post-deployment requirements
Development environments where quick iteration is more important than validation
Cost-sensitive deployments where additional resources should be minimized
Applications that handle all testing and validation in the Build stage
Proof-of-concept or MVP applications with minimal operational requirements
UpgradePath: Change PostDeployStageEnabled to 'true' to enable PostDeploy functionality
Add appropriate PostDeployBuildSpec file to repository
Configure PostDeployS3StaticHostBucket if artifact export is needed
Update PostDeploySvcRoleIncludeManagedPolicyArns if additional permissions required
Test PostDeploy functionality in development before enabling in production
